borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>a) Prior to first occupation of the unit hereby permitted, details of any ventilation system for the removal and treatment of cooking odours from any commercial catering, including its appearance and measures to mitigate system noise, are to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The measures shall have regard to and be commensurate with guidance and recommendations in: </p><ul><li>The current edition of publication '“Specification for Kitchen Ventilation Systems”, DW/172, Heating and Ventilating Contractors Association, or other relevant and authoritative guidance; and </li><li>Publication, “Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems – Update to the 2004 report prepared by NETCEN for the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs”, Ricardo.com, 2018. </li></ul><p>b) The approved details under part a)&nbsp;shall be fully implemented before the first use and shall thereafter be permanently retained in an efficient manner unless otherwise agreed in writing.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:</p><ul><li>Design and Access Statement - Received:<br></li><li>G024-01 - Existing and Proposed Ground Floor Plans - 09/06/2023</li><li>G024-04 - Proposed Front Elevation - 09/06/2023</li><li>G024-07 - Proposed Section Plan - 09/06/2023</li><li>Site Plan and Site Location Plan&nbsp; - Receievd: 09/08/2023</li></ul><p>No other drawings or documents apply.</p>

<p>a) Notwithstanding&nbsp;the approved plans, prior to first occupation,&nbsp;details of the cycle parking facilities,&nbsp;shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission should include details of the security, monitoring and access arrangements for the cycle parking facilities. </p><p>b) The development shall not be occupied until the approved details have been implemented. Thereafter, the cycle parking facilities shall be permanently retained.</p>

<p>a) Notwithstanding&nbsp;the approved plans, prior to first occupation, a detailed of the Refuse and Recycling Enclosure and Strategy for the café&nbsp;shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The Strategy shall include, but not be limited to, details of the design and location of any changes in the refuse and recycling stores, details of an unobstructed access and egress to the refuse stores and details of the frequency of collections. </p><p>b) The approved refuse and recycling stores and strategy&nbsp;shall be provided before the first occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained. Minor amendments may be agreed from time to time in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p>

<p>a) Notwithstanding&nbsp;the approved plans, prior to first occupation, details demonstrating to location of an accessible toilet and doorway widths must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to ensure these are suitable for disabled users.&nbsp;</p><p>b) The approved detail under part a) shall be installed and&nbsp;provided before the occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained.</p>
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
<p style="">The premises shall only be used for the purposes hereby permitted between 9 a.m. and 10p.m. on Mondays to Saturdays and between 9a.m. and 9p.m. on Sundays and Bank Holidays.&nbsp;</p>
subdivision_of_building: The proposal will only be conducted on the Ground Floor Level (which is the shop floor).
description: Change of use of ground floor barbershop (E) to a cafe (E)

constraints_details.result: Lbbd, 114 Church Elm Lane, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM10 9RL
